alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued April 20 at 8:41PM EDT until April 20 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...BRIEF SHALLOW COASTAL FLOODING POSSIBLE AROUND HIGH TIDE THIS EVENING IN DOWNTOWN CHARLESTON... Tide levels in the Charleston Habor could briefly reaching near 7 feet MLLW with high tide this evening. This will likely result in some brief, shallow coastal flooding in some of the normal locations throughout Downtown Charleston, including areas adjacent to Gadsden Creek. Motorists should be alert for saltwater across parts of Fishburne Street and Hagood Avenue. High tide in the Charleston Harbor will occur just after 916 PM.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
